meanings.definition: A person who trains others in military drills or exercises.
meanings.sent1: The drillmasters taught the soldiers how to march in formation.
meanings.sent2: The drillmasters led the training session on proper rifle handling.
meanings.sent3: The drillmasters decided to have a dance-off instead of a drill practice, much to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: The drillmasters were like conductors, orchestrating the movements of the soldiers with precision.
meanings.sent5: The image of the drillmasters barking orders will forever be etched in the recruits' minds.

meanings.definition: The group of individuals who lead and instruct a group in drill exercises.
meanings.sent1: The drillmasters assembled the recruits for the morning practice.
meanings.sent2: The drillmasters demonstrated the correct way to perform the salute.
meanings.sent3: The drillmasters decided to have a picnic instead of a drill session, causing confusion among the soldiers.
meanings.sent4: The drillmasters were the backbone of the unit, ensuring everyone was in sync.
meanings.sent5: The drillmasters' presence instilled a sense of discipline and order among the trainees.
